p: We then used analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) to determine if statistically significant differences in wetland area temporal trends depended on these six factors: orientation (west vs. east), elevation, slope, glacier cover in the catchment, initial wetland size and watershed area. For the five latter variables we compared the first and the last quartiles of each wetland variable distribution (e.g., 25% largest vs. 25% smallest wetlands, 25% steepest vs. 25% flattest wetlands and so on).
